DOC.brief_summary: ABSTRACT Introduction : Rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) systemic inflammatory , chronic progressive disease lead joint destruction important functional disability . Chronic inflammation , substantial increase amount pro-inflammatory cytokine synovial joint , one big challenge control RA . Resistance exercise recognize positively modulate inflammation healthy subject . Objective : To evaluate effect acute bout resistance exercise serum concentration tumor necrosis factor alpha ( TNF-α ) , interleukin 1 receptor antagonist ( IL-1ra ) , interleukin 1 beta ( IL-1β ) , C reactive protein ( CRP ) , interleukin 6 ( IL-6 ) , interleukin 10 ( IL-10 ) , cartilage oligomeric matrix protein ( COMP ) postmenopausal woman RA woman without disease . Methods : 17 volunteer RA 17 without disease , mean age 54.7 + 6.63 underwent resistance exercise session set 12 repetition 50 % one repetition maximum ( 1RM ) set 8 repetition 75 % 1RM . The exercise perform : knee extension , knee flexion , hip abduction hip adduction . Blood sample obtain 30 minute , 5 minute , immediately , 1 hour , 2 hour 24 hour exercise session . Serum glucose concentration prior exercise also measure . The investigator use Student's't test , model analysis variance repeat measure Bonferroni method multiple comparison analyze data , consider statistically significant level p < 0.05 .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Effect Resistance Training Inflammatory Markers Women With Rheumatoid Arthritis
DOC.criteria: *Rheumatoid Arthritis Group Women classify acording American College Rheumatology 's criterion rheumatoid arthritis Post menopausal woman Stable medication three month study Women rheumatoid arthritis functional class IV , acording ACR criterion Women engage type regular exercise program ; Failure : heart , coronary , respiratory , renal / hepatic ( uncompensated ) ; Uncompensated systemic hypertension ; Volunteers associate inflammatory disease ; Unable perform exercise . Control group We include control group study postmenopausal volunteer , without Rheumatoid Arthritis . Exclusion criterion adopt participant Rheumatoid Arthritis Group
